comments.body: `Handsontable` is not found. This is the reason I went with the `declare module "handsontable" { export = Handsontable; }` option.

the second declaration of `Handsontable` needs to be `declare var Handsontable: { ...`, not `interface Handsontable`. That's because `new` expects an actual object to be newed, not just a type. (This means that your class idea could be the right one, although I need to think about it a bit more.)

TypeScript does not pick up the declarations unless I wrap them in the module declaration. The reason it works in my other project is that I have noImplicitAny set to false. This is even after I change the interface to var.
